Posts.Content: jc268 wrote: hello  I'm wondering if anyone can shed any light on the meaning of lymphocytes being found in my biopsy. I had an FNA biopsy which found atypical cells (that part I understand), but it also yielded lymphocytes, and I'm less clear on the implications of that. My surgeon is recommending a core biopsy to get a better sample, so I'm waiting (yet again) for that appointment to be set up. In the meantime, I'm driving myself nutty googling lymphocytes... Background is I have a palpable lump in the right breast, upper outer quadrant, that they tell me feels more like a lump than a lymph node. It showed up on mammogram as a 1.5 cm nodular density. They did an FNA because ultrasound said it was a cyst, but then the FNA biopsy found a solid mass (possible that a cyst formed near it and obscured the mass during the ultrasound) as the FNA did not yield any fluid. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lymphocytes found in biopsy jc268 jc268

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2009 04:52AM jc268 wrote: He seemed to imply that the lymphocytes were potentially a troubling sign as he started saying we would need to get more tissue to see whether the lymphocytes were a false positive or not; he also started asking me questions about whether I'd been losing weight, feeling unwell, getting night sweats, etc. All of which made me a bit nervous. (The questions that is, not the symptoms, because I'm not having any of those issues...). Anyway, I guess I'll just have to wait and see. Next step is another ultrasound on the 29th. I found this lump in May and I'm still in test-mode. I'm really starting to lose it here.
Posts.Title: Lymphocytes found in biopsy jc268 jc268

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2009 05:19PM jc268 wrote: icey i concur - I've been diagnosed with atypia in my lump too, and everything I've learned suggests the excisional biopsy is the safe route to take in case anything worse is in there with the atypia. good luck.
Posts.Title: results from biopsy icey SueMomOf2

Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2009 07:30AM jc268 wrote: Hi paris yes I had an FNA biopsy that came back with atypia so they are doing further investigation. Just had an MRI, and am going for a core biopsy next week. Sometimes atypia is just that, but sometimes it can indicate that there may be cancer in the area. what kind of biopsy did you have? What did the report say?
Posts.Title: Inconclusive Biopsy??? paris1926 DenverDiva

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2009 05:13AM jc268 wrote: Hi Ausmum I'm 45 from Canada, and am in a similar state. Just got my needle biopsy results yesterday, which found atypical cells which the surgeon said are suggestive for malignancy. Did your doctor give you anything more than "inconclusive"? In my case, given the atypia, he said we were probably looking at a lumpectomy now and lymph node removal. Hard to take it all in. I totally understand the mind running wild. Thinking of you from across the world and wishing you benign results! jc
Posts.Title: New and on emotional rollercoaster AusMum vivvygirl
